thread.title: Ridgeland aldermen strike down tax increase
thread.title_full: Ridgeland aldermen strike down tax increase

title: Ridgeland aldermen strike down tax increase
text:
Ridgeland board of aldermen strikes down proposed tax increase: mayor says increase needed 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 9/2/15 6:14 am EDT - Updated: 9/2/15 6:16 am EDT 
RIDGELAND, Mississippi â€” The Ridgeland board of aldermen has struck down a proposed tax increase. 
In a 5-2 vote Tuesday night, the board approved the millage at its current rate of 20.03. 
The Clarion-Ledger reports ( http://on.thec-l.com/1EBey0R ) the proposed increase was 1.11 mills. 
Before the vote, aldermen went into executive session to discuss "economic development" and "potential litigation." 
The board met behind closed doors for an hour. When it went back into regular session, Alderman Brian Ramsey made the motion to keep the millage rate at the current rate of 20.03. 
Mayor Gene McGee previously said the millage increase was needed to supplement the city's lagging sales tax. 
Information from: The Clarion-Ledger, http://www.clarionledger.com
